description: Sense 1 is borrowed directly from Ancient Greek μικρολογία (mikrología, “pettiness, stinginess, triviality”), with the suffix reinterpreted as -logy.
Sense 2 is micro- +‎ -logy, effectively the same etymological components.

entries.meaning: The study of trivialities and minutiae.
That part of science that deals with microscopic objects, or depends on microscopic observation; microscopy.
